discussion.content:
SIP DNS SRVs in an Interdomain Federation Deployment
In the following example, multiple local domains must all resolve to the same Public FQDN and a DNS SRV record must be published for each domain that is hosted in the IM and Presence Service deployment. The following figure shows an example interdomain federation deployment with three local domains. You must publish a _sipfederationtls DNS SRV record for each domain. C is correct

Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/interdomain_federation/12_5_1/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251_chapter_011000.html?bookSearch=true

the Destination Pattern value must be ".com.domaina.*". and the option also missed the "."

questions.question_text: A collaboration engineer is configuring SIP interdomain federation for Cisco IM and Presence. The external domain cannot be discovered using DNS SRV. If the external enterprise domain is ciscocollab.com, what destination pattern should the engineer use for a static route?

An engineer is configuring XMPP federation on the Cisco IM and Presence server and has changed the security settings to TLS Optional on one node in the cluster. What is the next step in the configuration process?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
"If you make a change to any of the XMPP Federation settings, you must restart these services in the Cisco Unified IM and Presence Serviceability user interface: Cisco XCP Router (choose Tools > Control Center - Network Services), Cisco XCP XMPP Federation Connection Manager (chooseTools > Control Center - Feature Services). When you restart the Cisco XCP Router service, the IM and Presence Service restarts all the XCP services."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/interdomain_federation/12_5_1/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3_chapter_01101.html

Selected Answer: A
This is a call forward from the phone, and the forward all does not have CSS. that is why the call forward is failing.
The Chevy is C, association with INTERNAL_PT partition is missing.

Selected Answer: C
Should be C

The answer is C. The CSS on the Voice Mail Pilot should include partitions containing user phones and also the partition you set up for the voice mail pilot number. Here we can see the voice mail pilot is using the Null CSS which means the voice mail pilot can only reach numbers that are in the Null partition, ie directory numbers that have not been assigned a partition. Clearly the Hunt Pilot number (which is used for presenting the call to Unity Cnx ) is assoaited with a partition, ie INTERNAL_PT. So, in the above config the voice mail pilot would never be able to reach the Hunt Pilot number unless you gave the voice mail pilot a CSS that contained the INTERNAL_PT partition. Answer D is close but i only mentions Phones. The question is all about getting the call forwarded to voice mail via the Hunt Pilot and a SCCP port

But Ho did weknow that The CSS on the Voice Mail Pilot is missing partitions for user phones.? not mentioned
I think the 
C. The Voice Mail Pilot is not configured with a CSS that contains the INTERNAL_PT.
Answer is D. "The CSS on the Voice Mail Pilot is missing partitions for user phones" does not matter because the voicemail option is checked

comments.content: I meant to say that " The call forward and call pickup settings do not have a CSS on Forward All" does not matter because the voicemail option is checked
After s double-check ,answer D is the correct

discussion.content: A. The call forward and call pickup settings do not have a CSS on Forward All.

choices.A: The call forward and call pickup settings do not have a CSS on Forward All.
choices.D: The CSS on the Voice Mail Pilot is missing partitions for user phones.
choices.C: The Voice Mail Pilot is not configured with a CSS that contains the INTERNAL_PT.
choices.B: The Voice Mail Port partition on the CSS of the phone is missing.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
yep - A
"Once the static route is configured and unblocked, you cannot block any SIP domains (new or cached) from
the IM and Presence node. However, if you include Expressway in your deployment, you can block certain
SIP domains on the Expressway itself."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/interdomain_federation/12_5_1/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3/cup0_b_interdomain-federation-1251su3_chapter_010111.pdf

choices.A: Block the specified SIP domains on the Expressway.
choices.D: Configure default static routes for each blocked domain with an invalid next-hop IP address.
choices.B: Add each allowed domain as a SIP Federated Domain.
choices.C: Add a static route for each blocked domain and keep the “Block Route” checkbox checked.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure Open SIP Federation on Cisco IM and Presence using Cisco Expressways with the additional requirement not to allow a specific list of domains and allow all other domains that are not specified. How is this additional requirement met?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer B is correct,
- Cisco Push Notification Service—/var/log/active/cm/trace/ccmpns/log4j/
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/push_notifications/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide/cucm_b_push-notifications-deployment-guide_chapter_01.html

Refer to the exhibit. An administrator troubleshoots push notifications, and Cisco TAC requests the trace files from the cluster. From which location should the files be collected?
